translation: The eye realm and so forth (arising from the four bases of mindfulness) and the nose realm (ending with the absence of forgetfulness).

source_sentence: 第一百十六(之十四)　舌界　(身界　意界)(並無忘失起同無忘失終)眼界等(一切智起菩提終)地界(布施起內空終)。
translation: The eye realm and so forth (the end of the awakening of omniscience) and the earth realm (the end of the awakening of internal emptiness by generosity).

source_sentence: 第一百十七(之十五)　地界(真如起菩提終)無明(布施起菩提終)內空(布施起內空終)。
translation: The earth realm (the end of enlightenment arising from true thusness), ignorance (the end of enlightenment arising from generosity), and internal emptiness (the end of internal emptiness arising from generosity).

source_sentence: 第一百十八(之十六)　內空(真如起菩提終)真如(布施起五眼終)。
translation: 108(no. 16) Inner Emptiness (Truth gives rise to the end of enlightenment) and Truth (almsgiving gives rise to the end of the five eyes).

source_sentence: 第一百十九(之十七)　真如(佛十力起菩提終)苦聖(布施起菩提終)布施(布施起五眼終)。
translation: The 119th (no. 17) Truthfulness (the end of enlightenment arising from the Buddha's ten powers), suffering and saints (the end of enlightenment arising from generosity), and generosity (the end of the five eyes arising from generosity).

source_sentence: 第一百二十(之十八)　布施(佛十力起菩提終)四靜(布施起菩提終)八解(布施起佛十力終)。
translation: The One Hundred and Twentieth (no. 18) Almsgiving (the end of the Buddha's ten powers that give rise to enlightenment), the Four Quiet (the end of the Buddha's ten powers that give rise to enlightenment), and the Eight Understandings (the end of the Buddha's ten powers that give rise to enlightenment).

source_sentence: 〔辰〕第一百二十一(之十九)　八解(無忘起菩提終)四念(布施起菩提終)空解(布施起佛十力終)。
translation: (e) One hundred and twenty-first (no. 19): eight understandings (the end of enlightenment arising from nonforgetfulness), four quiescent (the end of enlightenment arising from generosity), and an empty understanding (the end of the Buddha's ten powers arising from generosity).

source_sentence: 第一百二十二(之二十)　空解(無忘起菩提終)五眼(布施起菩提終)佛十力(布施起無忘終)。
translation: One Hundred and Twenty-two (of Twenty) Understanding Emptiness (End of Enlightenment Arising from Unforgetfulness), Five Eyes (End of Enlightenment Arising from Giving), and Ten Powers of the Buddha (End of Enlightenment Arising from Unforgetfulness in Giving).

source_sentence: 第一百二十三(之二十一)　佛十力(一切智起菩提終)無忘(布施起菩提終)一切智(布施起菩提終)。
translation: One Hundred and Twenty-three (of 21): The Buddha's Ten Powers (End of Enlightenment Arising from Omniscience), Oblivion (End of Enlightenment Arising from Giving), and Omniscience (End of Enlightenment Arising from Giving).

source_sentence: 第一百二十四(之二十二)　陀羅尼　領流向(同布施起總菩提終)。
translation: One Hundred and Twenty-four (of 22) Dhāraṇīs Leading the Way (End of Total Enlightenment Arising from the Same Giving).

source_sentence: 第一百二十五(之二十三)　獨覺　菩薩行　菩提(同布施起並菩提終)『祇』般若(慶喜起菩提終)。
translation: One hundred and twenty-five (of twenty-three) solitary realizer, bodhisattva practice, and enlightenment (culminating in the parallel enlightenment that arises from generosity) and 'jñān' prajñā (culminating in the enlightenment that arises from joy).

source_sentence: 〔宿〕第一百三十六(之三十四)　『智』般若(色起至四靜慮終)。
translation: 136(no. 34) 'Wisdom' prajñā (from the arising of form to the end of the four states of meditation).

source_sentence: 第一百三十七(之三十五)　般若(八解脫起至菩提終)靜慮(色起至鼻界終)。
translation: The 137th (of 35) is prajñā (from the arising of the eight liberations to the end of enlightenment) and 'meditation' (from the arising of form to the end of the nose realm).

source_sentence: 第一百三十八(之三十六)　靜慮(舌界起無忘終)。
translation: 138(no. 36) Meditation (beginning in the tongue realm and ending in nonforgetfulness).

source_sentence: 第一百三十九(之三十七)　靜慮(一切智起菩提終)精進(色起至無明終)。
translation: One hundred and thirty-nine (of 37) is concentration (the end of enlightenment from the arising of omniscience) and exertion (the end of ignorance from the arising of form).

source_sentence: 第一百四十(之三十八)　精進(布施起菩提終)。
translation: One hundred forty (of thirty-eight) effort (the end of bodhi arising from generosity).

source_sentence: 〔列〕第一百四十一(之三十九)　安忍(色起至四淨慮終)。
translation: The 141st (no. 39) is patience (from the arising of form to the end of the four pure states of mind).

source_sentence: 第一百四十二(之四十)　安忍(八解脫起菩提終)淨戒(色起至舌界終)。
translation: The 142nd (of 40) is forbearance (ending with enlightenment arising from the eight liberations) and the purification of morality (ending with the arising of form and ending with the tongue realm).

source_sentence: 第一百四十三(之四十一)　淨戒(身界起至陀羅尼終)。
translation: The one hundred forty-three (of forty-one) pure precepts (beginning in the body realm and ending in the dhāraṇī).

source_sentence: 第一百四十四(之四十二)　淨戒(預流向起至菩提終)布施(色起至內空終)。
translation: One hundred forty-four (of forty-two) pure precepts (from the initiation of stream-winner to the end of enlightenment) and almsgiving (from the initiation of form to the end of internal emptiness).

source_sentence: 第一百四十五(之四十三)　布施(真如起菩提終)(有正經)。
translation: 145(43rd) Almsgiving (Truthfulness Arising to the End of Enlightenment) (Arising with the True Sutra).

source_sentence: 第一百四十六(之四十四)　『度』般若(色起至身界終)。
translation: 146(no. 44) 'Tathāgata' prajñā (from the arising of form to the end of the body realm) (Arhat Shōtoku Shōtoku).

source_sentence: 第一百四十七(之四十五)　般若(意界起四靜慮終)。
translation: 147(no. 45) 'Perfection of Wisdom' (beginning with the mind realm and ending with the four meditations).

source_sentence: 第一百四十八(之四十六)　般若(八解脫起預流向終)。
translation: 148(of 46) Prajñā (ending with the eight liberations that arise and the predirection that leads to liberation).

source_sentence: 第一百四十九(之四十七)　般若(獨覺起菩提終)靜慮(色起至鼻界終)。
translation: One hundred forty-nine (of forty-seven) are prajñā (the end of enlightenment arising from solitary realizers) and meditation (the end of form arising to the nasal realm).

source_sentence: 第一百五十(之四十八)　靜慮(舌界起真如終)。
translation: One Hundred and Fifty (of Forty-eight) Meditation (ending with the arising of true thusness in the tongue realm).

source_sentence: 〔張〕第一百五十一(之四十九)　靜慮(苦聖諦起一切智終)。
translation: [Zhang] 151(of 49) Stages of Meditation (End of Omniscience Arising from the Noble Truth of Suffering).

source_sentence: 第一百五十二(之五十)　靜慮(陀羅尼起至菩提終)精進(色起至耳界終)。
translation: 152 (of 50) Meditation (from the arising of the dhāraṇī to the end of enlightenment) and exertion (from the arising of form to the end of the auditory realm).

source_sentence: 第一百五十三(之五十一)　精進(鼻界起內空終)。
translation: One hundred and fifty-three (of fifty-one) is effort (beginning in the nose realm and ending in internal emptiness).

source_sentence: 第一百五十四(之五十二)　精進(真如起至無忘失終)。
translation: He makes effort (from the arising of true thusness to the end of absence of forgetfulness).

source_sentence: 第一百五十五(之五十三)　精進(一切智起菩提終)安忍(色起至色處終)。
translation: One hundred and fifty-five (of fifty-three) is effort (which culminates in the awakening of omniscience and the rise of enlightenment) and patience (which culminates in the rise of form and ends in the abode of form).

source_sentence: 第一百五十六(之五十四)　安忍(眼界起無明終)。
translation: One hundred and fifty-six (of fifty-four) forbearance (ending with the emergence of ignorance in the visual realm).

source_sentence: 第一百五十七(之五十五)　安忍(布施起至空解脫終)。
translation: One hundred and fifty-seven (of fifty-five) attains forbearance (from the arising of generosity to the end of liberation from emptiness).

source_sentence: 第一百五十八(之五十六)　安忍(五眼起菩提終)。
translation: One hundred and fifty-eight (of fifty-six) attains forbearance (the end of enlightenment that arises from the five eyes).

source_sentence: 第一百五十九(之五十七)　淨戒(色起至意界終)。
translation: One hundred and fifty-nine (of fifty-seven) pure morality (from the arising of form to the end of the mind realm).

source_sentence: 第一百六十(之五十八)　淨戒(地界起至四靜慮終)。
translation: The One Hundred and Sixtieth (of Fifty-eight) Pure Precepts (from the arising of the form realm to the end of the four states of meditation).

source_sentence: 〔寒〕第一百六十一(之五十九)　淨戒(八解脫起至獨覺菩提終)。
translation: The one hundred and sixty-one (fifty-ninth) pure precepts (arising from the eight liberations and ending with the enlightenment of pratyekabuddha).

source_sentence: 第一百六十二(之六十)　淨戒(菩薩行起至菩提終)布施(色起至舌界終)。
translation: The one hundred and sixty-second (no. 60) pure precepts (beginning with the bodhisattva practices and ending with enlightenment) and almsgiving (beginning with the form realm and ending with the tongue realm).

source_sentence: 第一百六十三(之六十一)　布施(身界起苦諦終)。
translation: One Hundred and Sixty-three (of 61) Almsgiving (from the arising of the body realm to the end of the truth of suffering).

source_sentence: 第一百六十四(之六十二)　布施(四靜慮起陀羅尼終)。
translation: One Hundred and Sixty-four (of 62) almsgiving (ending with the dhāraṇī of the arising of the four meditations).

source_sentence: 第一百六十五(之六十三)　布施(預流向起菩提終)『越』贍部洲(預流一來不還)至(西牛貨州終)。
translation: The 165th (of 63) generosity (ending with the initiation of the bodhi of stream-winner) 'crosses over' to the Jambudvīpa continent (ending with the initiation of stream-winner and non-returner) and arrives (ending in the western Oxus region).

source_sentence: 第一百六十六(之六十四)　北俱盧州(不還果起一切世界終)贍部洲(阿羅漢果起獨覺菩提起等覺心起換尾贍部州)並(一切世界終)。
translation: The one hundred and sixty-sixth (of sixty-four) state of northern Kulu (the nonreturner arises and all the worlds end), the state of Jambudvīpa (the arhat fruit arises, solitary realizer arises, bodhi arises, and the mind of virtual enlightenment arises, and the state of Jambudvīpa changes tails), and (all the worlds end).

source_sentence: 第一百六十七(之六十五)　贍部洲(不退轉地起一切世界終)『邊』(皆趣換頭)『際』(皆於換頭贍部起一切世界終)『聚』(贍部起西牛貨州終)。
translation: The one hundred and sixty-seventh (of 65) Jambudvīpa (the stage of nonretrogression that gives rise to the end of all worlds), 'limit' (all proceed to head change), 'limit' (all arise in the Jambudvīpa region that gives rise to the end of all worlds), and 'cluster' (the Jambudvīpa region that gives rise to the end of the West Oxfordshire region).

source_sentence: 〔來〕第一百七十四(之三)　『茲』(眼界起一切法終)『高』依般若(色起至布施終)。
translation: The 174th (ter) [cometh] 'here' (the eye realm gives rise to all dharmas) 'Gaoxiong' relies on prajñā (form gives rise to almsgiving).

source_sentence: 第一百七十五(之四)　依般若(內空起一切法終)(不作)依般若(色起無忘失終)(作大)。
translation: The 175th (quater) relies on prajñā (the end of all dharmas arising from internal emptiness) (does not do) relies on prajñā (the end of form arising without forgetfulness) (does great).

source_sentence: 第一百七十六(之五)　依般若(一切智起一切法終)(作大)不依般若(色起一切法終)(不作)。
translation: One hundred and seventy-six (5th) rely on prajñā (end of omniscience producing all dharmas) (become great) and don't rely on prajñā (end of form producing all dharmas) (don't do).

source_sentence: 第一百七十七(之六)　不依般若(色起一切法終　作大)(何以故入)『廣』(色起內空終)(若作)。
translation: 177(6) That which doesn't rely on prajñā (the end of all dharmas produced by form) (is made great) (why does it enter) 'extensively' (the end of internal emptiness produced by form) (if it's made).

source_sentence: 第一百七十八(之七)　『廣』(真如起一切法終)『廣』(換尾色起至五眼終)。
translation: 178(no. 7) 'Extensive' (end of the arising of all dharmas from true thusness) 'Extensive' (end of the substitution of the tail for the arising of form to the five eyes).

source_sentence: 第一百七十九(之八)　『廣』(佛十力起一切法終所以者何入)『義』(有情起無明終)。
translation: 179(eighth) 'Extensive' (what is the entry point for the ten powers of the Buddha that arise at the end of all dharmas) 'Meaningful' (the end of ignorance that arises in sentient beings).

source_sentence: 第一百八十(之九)　『義』(布施起至預流終)(避般若本法位)。
translation: 108(9) 'Meaning' (arising from generosity to the end of stream-winner) (avoiding the original state of the Dharma of Prajñāparinirvāṇa).

source_sentence: 『暑』第一百八十二(之一)　『撮』非縛(色起至菩提終)『成』前際後際(同色起並至菩提終)(中際)(色起至菩提終)。
translation: "The one hundred and eighty-second (1) 'Summary' is not fettered (from the arising of form to the end of enlightenment), 'accomplished' is at the beginning, middle, and end (from the arising of the same form and to the end of enlightenment) (middle) (from the arising of form to the end of enlightenment).

source_sentence: 第一百八十三(之二)　『成』中際(布施起菩提終)『祕』果(色起至菩提終)『密』般若(色起至菩薩十地終)。
translation: 183(bis) 'Becoming' (the middle limit (when generosity arises and reaches the end of enlightenment) 'Secret' fruit (when form arises and reaches the end of enlightenment) 'Esoteric' prajñā (when form arises and reaches the end of the bodhisattva's ten stages).

source_sentence: 第一百八十四(之三)　般若(五眼起菩提終)『密』一切智智(色起至菩提終)『關』我(是十三法齊行色至眼處終)。
translation: 184(ter) Prajñā (the five eyes give rise to the end of enlightenment), 'esoteric' omniscience (form gives rise to the end of enlightenment), and 'close-minded' self (these are the thirteen qualities that come together in form and form to the end of the eye).

source_sentence: 第一百八十五(之四)　我(色處起　眼界　耳界　鼻界)至(舌界終)。
translation: I (form arises in the sense of the eye realm, ears, and nose realm) ... (reaches the end of the tongue realm).

source_sentence: 第一百八十六(之五)　我(身界起　意界　地界　無明)至(布施終)。
translation: The one hundred eighty-sixth (fifth) is I (arising in the body realm, mind realm, and earth realm, and nescience) up to (the end of generosity).

source_sentence: 第一百八十七(之六)　我(內空起　真如　苦諦　四靜慮)至(八解脫終)。
translation: 187(no. 6) I (internal emptiness arises, true thusness, truth of suffering, and the four meditations) to (the end of the eight liberations).

source_sentence: 第一百八十八(之七)　我(四念起　空解　菩薩　五眼　佛十力)至(無忘失終)。
translation: 108(sevens) I (four states of mindfulness, arising of emptiness, understanding of the five eyes of the bodhisattvas, and the ten powers of the Buddha) ... (ending with no forgetfulness).

source_sentence: 第一百八十九(之八)　我(一切智起　陀羅　預流　獨覺　菩薩行)至(菩提終)。
translation: One hundred and eighty-ninth (eighth) is I (the arising of omniscience, dharmas, precepts, solitary realizers, and bodhisattva practices) through (the end of enlightenment).

source_sentence: 第一百九十(之九)　『關』我(是十三法各行色起)有情(色起至菩提終)命者(色起至無明終)。
translation: The 190th (no. 9) 'Concerning' self (these 13 dharmas arise from form in all walks of life), sentient beings (form arises to the end of enlightenment), and living beings (form arises to the end of ignorance).

source_sentence: 〔往〕第一百九十一(之十)　命者(布施起菩提終)生者(色起至菩提終)養育者(色起至菩薩十地終)。
translation: The 191st (of 10) [goes] to those who are alive (end of enlightenment from generosity), born (end of enlightenment from form), and nurtured (end of the ten stages of bodhisattvahood from form).

source_sentence: 第一百九十二(之十一)　養育者(五眼起菩提終)士夫(色起至菩提終)補特伽羅(色起至菩提終)。
translation: The 192nd (no. 11) nurturer (the end of enlightenment from the five eyes), the man (the end of enlightenment from form), and the person (the end of enlightenment from form).

source_sentence: 第一百九十三(之十二)　意生　儒童(並色起同至菩提終)作者(色起至舌界終)。
translation: One hundred and ninety-three (of twelve) mental beings: the youth (who also has form that arises and reaches the end of enlightenment) and the author (who has form that arises and reaches the end of the tongue).

source_sentence: 第一百九十四(之十三)　作者(身界起菩提終)受者(色起至菩提終)知者(色起至菩薩十地終)。
translation: The author (body realm arises to the end of enlightenment), the recipient (form arises to the end of enlightenment), and the knower (form arises to the end of the bodhisattva's tenth ground).

source_sentence: 第一百九十五(之十四)　知者(五眼起菩提終)見者(色起至菩提終)『簡』我(是十三法添智各行色起)有情(色起至耳界終)。
translation: The one hundred and ninety-fifth (of fourteen) knower (the five eyes rise to the end of enlightenment), seer (form rises to the end of enlightenment), and 'briefly' self (these are the thirteen dharmas, additions, and wisdoms that arise from form in all walks of life) and sentient beings (form rises to the end of the ear realm).

source_sentence: 第一百九十六(之十五)　有情(鼻界起菩提終)命者(色起至菩提終)生者(色起至無明終)。
translation: The one hundred and ninety-sixth (of fifteen) is sentient beings (arising from the nose realm to the end of enlightenment), living beings (arising from form to the end of enlightenment), and born beings (arising from form to the end of ignorance).

source_sentence: 第一百九十七(之十六)　生者(布施至菩提終)養育者(色起至菩提終)士夫(色起至無明終)。
translation: One hundred and ninety-seventh (of sixteen) is the living (end of almsgiving ... enlightenment), the nurturing (end of the production of form ... enlightenment), and the man (end of the production of form ... ignorance).

source_sentence: 第一百九十八(之十七)　士夫(布施至菩提終)補特伽羅(色起至菩提終)意生(色起至菩薩十地終)。
translation: One hundred and ninety-eight (of seventeen) are men (from the end of generosity to enlightenment), personalities (from the end of the production of form to enlightenment), and mind-made beings (from the end of the production of form to the end of the bodhisattva's tenth ground).

source_sentence: 第一百九十九(之十八)　意生(五眼起菩提終)儒童　作者(並色起俱至菩提終)。
translation: The 199(no. 18) mind-made (the end of enlightenment from the arising of the five eyes) and the youth-made (the end of enlightenment from both the arising of form and the bodhisattva stage).

source_sentence: 第二百(之十九)　受者　知者(並色起同至菩提終)。
translation: The 200(nineteenth) recipient and knower (and form arises together and reaches the end of enlightenment).

source_sentence: 〔秋〕第二百一(之二十)　見者(色起至菩提終)『束』貪(色起至菩提終)瞋(色起至無明終)。
translation: Those who see (and form arises to the end of enlightenment) 'bind' greed (form arises to the end of enlightenment) and anger (form arises to the end of ignorance).

source_sentence: 第二百二(之二十一)　瞋(布施起菩提終)癡(色起至菩提終)『盡』貪(添一切智色起至菩薩十地終)。
translation: 222(no. 21) Anger (arising from generosity to the end of enlightenment), delusion (arising from form to the end of enlightenment), and 'exhaustion' of greed (arising from the addition of form to omniscience to the end of the bodhisattva's ten stages).

source_sentence: 第二百三(之二十二)　貪(五眼起至菩提終)瞋癡(並色起同菩提終)。
translation: 243(no. 22) Greed (the arising of the five eyes to the end of enlightenment), anger, and delusion (the arising of form together with the end of enlightenment).

source_sentence: 第二百四(之二十三)　『三』鈎鏁(色起至菩提並單成法關)。
translation: The 2,400 (no. 23) 'three' hooks (the arising of form to the end of enlightenment and the accomplishment of the Dharma barrier alone).

source_sentence: ○大般若波羅蜜多經卷第一百三十
translation: ○The Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, Vol. 130

source_sentence: △初分校量功德品第三十之二十八
translation: △The First Chapter of the Chapter on the Quantitative Merit of the Branch, Thirty-two, Twenty-eight
It was then that the Buddha praised Śakra, saying.
"Good, good!
It's just as you've said.
Kauśika.
'Suppose good men, good women, and so forth.

source_sentence: 書寫如是甚深般若波羅蜜多。
translation: Write down such a profound prajñā-pāramitā.
They're adorned with multitudes of treasures.
They decorate them with an infinite variety of the finest flower garlands.
They rub them with scattering incense and so forth.
Their robes are adorned with ornaments.
Jeweled banners and streamers decorate them.
They're filled with marvelous, genuine wonders.
Music, music, and lamps.
They make all of them available.
They make offerings, venerate, respect, and praise them.

translation: One hundred and thirty-one (thirty-nine) Jambudvīpa and the other four continents (ten good beginnings) to (Bodhi) the lesser chiliocosm (ten good beginnings), the middle chiliocosm (ten good beginnings) to (Bodhi) the three thousand chiliocosms (ten good beginnings), and (and not beyond) the end.

source_sentence: 第一百三十二(三十之三十)　三千界(住四果起)至(菩提)殑伽沙界(十善起)至(菩提)十方世界(十善起)至(菩提)贍部洲(四靜慮起)至(菩提)終。
translation: The one hundred and thirty-second (thirty of thirty) chiliocosm (abiding in the arising of the four fruits) to (enlightenment), the sands realm (arising of the ten good qualities) to (enlightenment), the worlds in the ten directions (arising of the ten good qualities) to (enlightenment), and the Jambudvīpa continent (arising of the four meditations) to the end (of enlightenment).

source_sentence: 第一百三十三(三十之三十一)　二洲(靜慮起)至(菩提)三洲(靜慮起)至(菩提)四洲(靜慮起)至(菩提)終。
translation: The 133rd (31st of 30), the 2nd continent (arising from meditation) to (enlightenment), the 3rd continent (arising from meditation) to (enlightenment), and the 4th continent (arising from meditation) to the end (of enlightenment).

source_sentence: 第一百三十四(三十之三十二)　小千界(靜慮起)至(菩提)中千界(靜慮起)至(菩提)三千界(靜慮起)至(菩提)殑伽界(靜慮起)至(百千倍故)終。
translation: One hundred and thirty-four (thirty-two) worlds (arising from meditation) in the lesser chiliocosm to (bodhi), (arising from meditation) in the middle chiliocosm to (bodhi), (arising from meditation) in the 3,000 chiliocosm to (bodhi) in the sogas realm (arising from meditation) to (bodhi) at the end (due to a hundred thousandfold).

source_sentence: 第一百三十五(三十之三十三)　殑伽界(令住獨起)至(菩提)十方界(四靜起)至(菩提)於此般若(勝於起)至(十方界有一段經不通關)。
translation: One hundred and thirty-five (of thirty-three) sands realm (caused to abide alone and arise) to (bodhi) ten directions realm (four quiescent arises) to (bodhi) here Prajñāpāramitā (is superior to arising) to (there's a section of the sutra in the ten directions realm that doesn't go beyond the barrier).

source_sentence: 大般若波羅蜜多經關法卷第四
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra-Guṇḍavyūha-vol. 4
